prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.5, 0.0]. To generate the 2D sketch, draw the following lines on the plane defined by the coordinate system: 1. Line 1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] 2. Line 2: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.625] 3. Line 3: Start Point = [0.75, 0.625], End Point = [0.0, 0.625] 4. Line 4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.625], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Follow these steps to transform the 2D sketch into 3D: 1. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. 2. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector defined earlier. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrusion depth towards the normal is 0.5 units and the extrusion depth opposite the normal is 0 units. The length and width of the part are 0.75 units and the height is 0.75 units, making the overall dimensions of the prism 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. This completes part 1. Final Shape: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Since this is the final part, there are no further steps to follow. The completed CAD model represents the desired rectangular prism.</description>
